author: K Manikandan
text:
At the two-wheeler parking lot at the Moore Market Complex (MMC) at Chennai Central suburban, one is greeted by an interesting sight. Here, helmets, which are made for protecting people from harm, receives protection.

To help motorcyclists whose vehicles lack the provision for locking their helmets, contractors at the parking lot, opposite Railway Protection Force police station at MMC, offer to guard the helmets of the motorcyclists. They fix a sticker with some details — the number of the tokens issued to the rider and also the date and the time of parking.

When motorcyclists return to the lot, they have to hand over the parking token and collect the helmet. The staff at the parking lot said that over 1,500 motorcycles were being parked there every day and there had been many complaints from vehicle owners about missing helmets.

To prevent theft, they had installed closed circuit television cameras (CCTV) and ensured safe keeping of helmets of those riders who did not have the wire lock or a permanent helmet lock attached to the rear grip above the tail light.
title: To ensure safe ride, helmets are guarded here
